Shang-Chieh’s webpage

Last updated: 2024-02-25

Welcome to my webpage. I’m Shang-Chieh Wei. I’m currently a graduate student in the Department of Economics at National Taiwan University. You can download my CV here.

Education

  • M.A. in Economics

    September 2022 - Present, National Taiwan University, Taiwan

    Thesis Topic: Analyzing the Impact of Policies and Macroeconomic Factors on Electric Vehicle Sales

  • B.A. in Economics (with a Minor in Public Finance)

    September 2018 - June 2022, National Chengchi University, Taiwan

Scholarships, Awards and Honors

  • Honorary membership of The Phi Tau Phi Scholastic Honor Society of the Republic of China, 2022

    A certificate that warrants students who have achieved academic excellence upon graduation to be selected as honorary members of the Society by National Chengchi University.

    Every domestic university may recommend up to 1% of undergraduate graduands that are excellent in academic performance as well as moral conduct to receive the honorary membership of the Society. The recommendation criteria are subject to the average of semester grades prior to the semester of graduation.

  • The Memorial Scholarship Foundation to Lin Hsiung Chen, 2021

    This scholarship is designed to reward outstanding students from public and private universities, as well as independent colleges in Taiwan. There are only 50 scholarships available nationwide. Applicants must have achieved an overall average score of 85 or above in their academic performance for the previous academic year.

  • Outstanding Student Scholarship, College of Social Sciences, NCCU, 2020 Spring, 2021 Fall

    From the second semester of the first year to the first semester of the fourth year, having completed at least 12 credits in the preceding semester.

    Attaining a ranking within the top ten percent (unconditionally rounded up) of students in each department and class within the undergraduate division, based on the previous semester’s academic performance.

    Achieving a passing grade or higher in all courses and having no records of course withdrawal or disciplinary actions in the preceding semester.

  • Professor Liu, Xing-Hua Memorial Scholarship, Department of Public Finance, NCCU, Spring 2020

    This scholarship is awarded to the student with the highest academic performance in the field of economics.

  • Academic Excellence Awards, NCCU, Fall 2018, Spring 2019, Fall 2019, Spring 2020, Fall 2020, Spring 2021, Fall 2021

    Students who rank in the top 5% (rounded up unconditionally) in their department and year in a semester shall be given a scholarship and a certificate.

  • Econ and Finance
